intro: Thlaspi verlotii, commonly known as the alpine cabbages or alpine crucifer, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with rosettes of dark green, hairy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high altitudes where conditions are harsh. Thlaspi verlotii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in meadows, slopes, and crevices in mountainous terrain.
